a8f9454c20902641f25daa98ea52073f (15:14): I have a catalyst 4507 switch that i just configured. Currently connected to a another switch via fiber. Everything is working ok. All ports are assigned to vlan1 after setting the default gateway I was able to use the ports. Now I want to be able to create vlans on the switch. My goal is to create 3 vlans and move ports into them. However when doing so I loose the ability of communicating with ports when outside of the vlan.

cc9aab29ebea79d6850e644dfe75f241 (15:18): traffic must be routed between VLANs.  your switch can do it, but then it becomes a router.  to accomplish this, create a VLAN interface for each vlan ('interface Vlan 2') and assign it an IP address.  then use this address as the default gateway for hosts on that VLAN.
a8f9454c20902641f25daa98ea52073f (15:23): Catfive: after assining the vlan interface to an ip do I have to do anything with ip routing?
cc9aab29ebea79d6850e644dfe75f241 (15:23): you can configure 'no shutdown' on the VLAN interface and 'ip routing' globally, just to make sure things are enabled.
a8f9454c20902641f25daa98ea52073f (15:25): Catfive: so it is necessary to use the ip rotuing option globally
